reviews.review:
Oftmals geht vergessen, dass es neben Freeman und dem G-Man auch andere Figuren im Half-Life-Universum gibt. So wäre da etwa Corporal Shepard, der zur gleichen Zeit wie Freeman in Black Mesa unterwegs war. In Opposing Force, dem erste AddOn zu Half-Life, wird seine Geschichte erzählt.

Wer bereits das Hauptspiel gespielt hat, wird sich von der Spielmechanik her sofort zuhause fühlen, jedoch einige interessante Ergänzungen bemerken, die das Spiel sehr bereichern. So werden etwa neben neuen, konventionellen Waffen auch organische Alienwaffen und anspruchsvollere Gegner eingeführt oder auch die Möglichkeit geboten, mit anderen Soldaten in den Kampf zu ziehen.

Was die Handlung angeht, ist Opposing Force insofern von Interesse, als dass man einige Hintergründe zu den Abläufen in Black Mesa erfährt und erleben kann, was sich während der Handlung von Half-Life sonst noch abgespielt hat. Zudem werden aufmerksame Spieler mit einigen Anspielungen und netten Easter Eggs belohnt.

Insgesamt ist Opposing Force ein gutes Spiel mit einem guten Tempo, das auf jeden Fall mehr Aufmerksamkeit verdient hat. Einziger Wehrmutstropfen: Die deutsche Fassung ist geschnitten.
Too easy, still fun though.

A pretty good expansion to the classic half life anthology. Adds some pretty cool weapons to the original half life.

You play as special forces agent Adrian Shephard (not the one from Mass Effect though LOL) who is on a mission to the black mesa research facility performing government orders to wipe out any remaining life-forms there. As you reach there, you find yourself entangled with the aliens while you try to make your escape; only to finally fall into the hands of the Mysterious G-Man.

Though dated on the graphics department now, its a must play for all half life fans. Play this before you take a dig at the half life 2 anthology.

Fantastic expansion for the half-life universe.

New weapons, more pleasant encounters with scientist than in the first half-life.

More complex HECU units with more variety in the apperal aspect of the soldiers.

Different skillsets for soldiers in your platoon I.E.; Engineer Torching down sealed doors, medics for healing, etc.

I recommend you save frequently because them auto-saves are IMO not frequent enough.

Sadly the military still wants to kill you even though your on they're team 

( Exluding the HECU soldiers known for their grey camo and Green PCV vest, enemy military units will be in all black. )
This game is very very very very fun with friends, also the single-layer part is fantastic. Many twists.

На мой взгляд основной задачей дополнения было показать роль военных сил в игре, их присутствие и почему собственно они "не дружат" с Фриманом. Как по мне так дополнение с этим справилось.

Comenzamos, Half life opposing force es la primera expansión del juego original, La historia trata del soldado adrián shepar que es enviado a matar a todos los sobrevivientes de la explosión de black mesa, en especial freeman.
La historia ocurre paralelamente a la trama que vive freeman es por eso que en algunos momentos del juego podremos ver partes donde paso o encontrarnos con él. Para ser una expansión tuvo cambios buenos, armas, historia etc.
Sin duda se lo recomiendo a cualquiera que haya jugado el juego base y quiera saber más de la historia, aunque solo la refresca ya que no profundiza tanto.
El final G-man nos lleva con el diciendo que donde iremos estaremos a salvo y no podremos decir nada de lo que paso.
Las armas me parecían excelentes mucho mejor que el juego base a mi opinión. Si jugaste el primero, sin duda debes comprar este.

To get the most out of playing Opposing Force, you'll want to have played the original Half-Life first. In Opposing Force, you play a marine that gets caught in the events of Half-Life. Opposing Force plays out very similarly to the original Half-Life, both in terms of gameplay and story. The gameplay in Opposing Force was generally improved over the original Half-Life. However, I was not a big fan of the platforming (in either game). The hookshot mechanics in Opposing Force were particularly poor. The game has three difficulties. I played through the game on medium difficulty at a casual/leisurely pace, and I completed the game after about 11 hours. Everything considered, if you enjoyed the original Half-Life then you'll enjoy this game, and I think Opposing Force was worth playing.

We all know Half-Life is the classic. If you enjoyed Half-Life... you may find Opposing Force a little disappointing. In brief; Opposing Force puts you in the shoes of Adrian Shepard... one of the Soldiers sent in to 'clean up' Black Mesa.  Of course things go horribly wrong and you wind up fighting for your survuival and the fate of the world.

The Good:

* Most of the good things about Half-Life carry over.
* New and interesting Enemies
* New and interesting Weapons to kill New and Interesting Enemies with.
* Explore New Areas of Black Mesa

All in all a solid expansion and the idea of having a squad of specialize d soldiers to help you with is always great and leads to some interesting challenges. The Alien X Race also makes for tough antagonists. THe new black ops are also a joy.

The Bad


* Mundane Area Design.
* Bad Lighting
* Disjointed STory
* Gimmicky

Yeah, the biggest problem here is the lighting. I know Gearbox thought their Light Amp thingie was cool and it admittedly better than the flash light but... it's not practically to have the areas so dark you have to leave it on half the txchuffin time. You will be seeing alot of green in this game.

Also the level design ... is dodgey. As in you don't quite feel the interconnection between the areas. In short they feel more like levels and less like actual parts pof a facility in some cases. A minor quibble. Also there are a timed few trial and error sections that will annoy you.

Lastly it does feel Gimmickjy. SInce you spend most of your time fighting the allien X creatures... it's actually easy to forget that you're in the same Black Mesa as Gordon freeman and Barney Calhoun. It Might as well have been a different facility all together.

Out of the two expansions this feels like the most tangental of them, and the least polished. There's also not much of the story being woven into the background, and it simply lacks the pacing of either Half-Life or Blue Shift.

Not that it is a bad game.. it's still quite good but it is a step down rather than hup. Thankffully Half Life raised the bar enough that even a step down is still a high mark.

In the first expansion to Half-Life, you play as Adrian Shephard, a soldier who was part of the special forces military unit that was meant to wipe out pretty much anything that moves during the first game. However, before he can receive his orders properly, he is rendered unconscious. When he wakes up, he finds that his comrades are pulling out as they find they can't fight off the aliens. With the help of the facility personnel, Adrian must escape Black Mesa alive. This game's story and gameplay mostly mirrors the original game, but has enough variety to keep it interesting. I'd say it's a solid expansion. 8.5/10

Half Life: Opposing Force é a primeira expansão de Half Life e te põe como um dos soldados HECU que foram enviados para o complexo para eliminar o pessoal de Black Mesa e os alienígenas, você é o cabo Adrian Shepard a caminho do lugar pra fazer essa missão, acontece que antes de receber as ordens do seu comandante o helicoptero em que todos estavam é abatido por uma criatura de Xen e poucos sobrevivem... A partir daí você terá que contar com a ajuda de outros soldados aliados e cientistas pra poder sobreviver.

No geral é uma ótima expansão, com os eventos ocorrendo em paralelo com os de Half Life, tendo uma variedade maior de armas, sendo quase o dobro de HL1, e claro, mais inimigos desafiadores como a Raça X e os Black Ops. 

Os gráficos são os mesmos, mas a Valve lançou um pacote em HD para armas e personagens que também pode ser habilitado em HL1 e em Blue Shift(expansão que foi lançada após Opposing Force), deixando o visual um pouco melhor.

Jogo recomendado! 10/10
This is the best game ever released by Gearbox Software, which can be considered sad by many.  It deserves the title Half life, and it deserves to be praised.

Вообще Opposing Force это аддон для Half Life, но мне кажется, что это не так! Ведь тут есть и увлекательный сюжет, и новые виды противников и союзников, даже в мультиплеер добавили новый режим!
Что касается сюжета, то Half-Life: Opposing Force изображает события, произошедшие в Half-Life, но c точки зрения солдата HECU. Игрок во время игры может увидеть, как пробегает по своим делам доктор Гордон Фримен; посмотреть как главнокомандующий HECU отдаёт по радио приказ, который слышал по радио доктор Гордон Фримен; герой посетит уже знакомые места.
Всем фанатам серии и вообще ценителям хороших игр обязательна к прохождению!

Half Life: Opposing force is an extension to the original Half Life game.
You play as a soldier interventing during the Black Mesa incident, so it happens (at least starts) during HL1's event. 
It's a good extension and is worth giving a try if you liked HL1, as it brings a few new elements (weapons, some new gameplay possibilities like interaction with props) and it's always good to meet again these stupid Rambo sounding soldiers.

Игра имеет графику своего предшедственника, значит особых извенений там нет и графа прямо скажем не на высоте. 
Так же в игре есть геймплей, куда ж без него то. Но теперь у нас стало куда больше оружия на выбор. 
А в целом игра так и осталось неизменной, но если вы все же играли в первую часть и прошли её, то эта игра вам тоже должна понравиться.

A lot of love and care clearly went into this game. Unlike Blue Shift, Opposing Force adds in many new character models, enemies, weapons, and even game mechanics. The storyline itself is very much reflective of Half-Life, following a similar pattern and progression, even the same themes.

The game is difficult, arguably unfairly at times. It's thankfully mitigated my Half-Life's lovely quicksave/quickload system, which I found myself relying more and more on as the game progressed, to the point of literally save-scumming certain battles repeatedly just to ensure I had enough health to move on effectively. I would not recommend normal/hard difficulties to those not already very comfortable with Half-Life mechanics.

Follower/squad AI is abysmal. No really, it's not even functional, but I feel like this is an engine limitation. AI companions are certainly not underpowered, but their ability to actually follow you at all is shoddy at best. Additionally there's apparently nothing in their scripting to tell them, "don't shoot if the player character is between you and the target," because at one point I found myself killed by an overenthusiastic squadmate who was directly behind me. Thankfully, sections of the game incorporating AI companions are very short, rarely going beyond a couple rooms.

Those couple gripes aside, the game is phenomenal and a must-play for fans of the original Half-Life.

Extremely fun, I especially LOVED the alien weapons such as the Barnacle and the Shock Roach. However, this game does have some flaws. For example, the ropes in the game are ridiculously (in my experience anyway) hard to master, and the night vision almost blinds you with a bright green color. Nevertheless, this is still an amazing game for those who love a good story, and an even better one for those who love shooting stuff too.

Best expansion for a game : EVER!
I haven't had so much enjoyment playing an expansion pack.
Opposing Force not only expands the main game, but adds major updates to the already grand foundation laid out by Half-Life. The story starts right where Half-Life starts, but you're controlling a commando of the HECU unit (who were the army squadrons that were trying to kill you and the Black Mesa scientists in the original game) and the plot cuts off to a different direction that we never got to see before and also you get to have super cool buddies and with many additions to the game like : new weapons, different equipment, lots of new characters, better AI, squad mates, lots of new enemies etc.
And best thing is, this game is really cheap on sale with the Valve Anthology pack.

9/10

Рекоммендую всем, но в первую очередь владельцам Linux`ов и слабых систем. Игра отличная. Графика хорошая, приятная. Большой ассортимент оружия.  играл только в мультиплеер. Он отличный! Но в мультиплеере есть один минус : в него почти никто не играет. Сервера есть, но максимум на сервере будет 6 человек.Кампания интересная. Отличается от всех современных шутеров типа колды и боталфилда : здесь надо думать. В кампании будет очень много логических задач, а иногда будут элементы хорроров.

An excellent expansion pack from developer Gearbox! I wonder how many of us still know what expansions were... nowadays these extra stories would come in the form of DLCs not an expansion pack. It meant to indicate a longer story and this is definitely a bigger pack than a dlc which can be a single weapon or a new costume for a character in the game.

In any case, Opposing Force puts us in the shoes of a corporal, a certain Adrian Shepard, who - along with his fellow soldiers - is sent to neutralise the enemies invading the Black Mesa facility. As expected, things go awry and you are alone facing the good-old aliens. There is a new assortment of weapons, new enemies and new music. Oh, and there are fat security officers helping you!

By the way: the game comes with widescreen settings and vsync can be switched on! Just excellent!

A relatively long and challenging expansion pack that comes very cheap. It did age a lot throughout the 15 years but it is still a great game... at least for reminiscing purposes.

I was very young when I first layed eyes upon the Half-Life universe, eagerly soaking up what was then a masterpiece of graphical splendour with a creepy edge like few other games at the time. By the time I was old enough to truly appreciate the games I grew up seeing my father and brother playing, Half-Life wasn't quite at the cutting edge, but still I loved it to bits.

So to expand upon what was already for me an iconic game was very appealing. I picked up the Half-Life Anothology (which also included Blue-Shift) and started Opposing Force. The atmosphere is very much similar to the original Half-Life, but the expanded themes, puzzles, weapons and 'monsters' made the experience much deeper. The fights are harder, ammunition can get pretty scarce and managing the skillsets of your fleeting (and somewhat disposable) squadmates makes for more thought-provoking tactics and gameplay. 

I liked the classes of friendly grunts, each having their own particular value. Keeping the Medics alive in the later stages is a must as medkits dry up and the Xen alien forces become stronger and more diverse. The heavys and engineers too have their own role (although the latter only have certain points at which they are useful). The AI is somewhat improved over the original (or at least I thought so), and the aliens aren't simply using the rush tactic all the time. Some will take time to think about flanking and flushing you out of fixed positions with ranged explosives.

Graphically, the story is the same as the original (and Blue Shift, with the HD pack installed) and you will meet many familair allies and enemies, though both have variances that seem merely cosmetic. The design of the new enemies is very much in keeping with the original, and overall they make a very much positive impact. The locales too are what you'd expect from Black Mesa architecture, with some overlap with HL levels (which I suppose are justified).

If you are a fan of the Half-Life series, have enjoyed the original Half-Life and want to expand the gameplay, this expansion is worth every penny (I imagine that most Half-Life fans by now have, like me, played this and Blue Shift to death).  Don't compare it to contemporary shooters (if you are new to HL1), it's not up to the expected standard, but this game and all expansions have stood the test of time and aged exceptionally well, thanks in part to a very active mod community.

Must-Buy!

Классный аддон: новые враги, новое оружие, новые локации и взгляд на события первой части глазами морпеха.  Намного лучше и качественнее Blue shift.
